ANOVAs Report

Source: R/report.aov.R
report.aov.Rd

Create a report of an ANOVA.

# S3 method for aov
report(
  model,
  interpretation = "field2013",
  omega_squared = "partial",
  eta_squared = NULL,
  epsilon_squared = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

model

Object of class aov, anova or aovlist.
interpretation

Effect size interpretation set of rules (see interpret_omega_squared).
omega_squared

Compute omega squared as index of effect size. Can be "partial" (adjusted for effect size) or "raw".
eta_squared

Compute eta squared as index of effect size. Can be "partial" (adjusted for effect size), "raw" or "adjusted" (the latter option only for anova-tables from mixed models).
epsilon_squared

Compute epsilon squared as index of effect size. Can be "partial" (adjusted for effect size) or "raw".
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

See also

report

Examples

data <- iris
data$Cat1 <- rep(c("A", "B"), length.out = nrow(data))
model <- aov(Sepal.Length ~ Species * Cat1, data = data)
r <- report(model)
r
#> The ANOVA suggests that:
#> 
#>   - The main effect of Species is significant (F(2, 144) = 118.43, p < .001) and can be considered as large (partial omega squared = 0.61).
#>   - The main effect of Cat1 is not significant (F(1, 144) = 0.01, p = 0.937) and can be considered as very small (partial omega squared = -0.01).
#>   - The interaction between Species and Cat1 is not significant (F(2, 144) = 0.98, p = 0.377) and can be considered as very small (partial omega squared = -2.40e-04).
table_short(r)
#> Parameter    | Sum_Squares |  df | Mean_Square |      F |        p | Omega_Sq_partial
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Species      |       63.21 |   2 |       31.61 | 118.43 | 3.87e-31 |             0.61
#> Cat1         |        0.00 |   1 |        0.00 |   0.01 |     0.94 |            -0.01
#> Species:Cat1 |        0.52 |   2 |        0.26 |   0.98 |     0.38 |        -2.40e-04
#> Residuals    |       38.43 | 144 |        0.27 |        |          |
